snippet: Why are people drawn to zoos? Among other reasons, it may be the special kind of innocence they hope to find there.
abstract: Why are people drawn to zoos? Among other reasons, it may be the special kind of innocence they hope to find there.
lead_paragraph: WHEN the Warsaw Zoo was bombed during World War II, killing most of the animals, the zookeepers devised a dangerous plan: they decided to use the cages and enclosures to hide more than 300 Jews who were fleeing the Nazis. Their refuge became one of the most successful hide-outs of the war.
